felixroom1.description: Now that Lucie has drawn pictures of which toy goes in what bucket, Felix actually puts up one bucket's toys before starting to play with a different bucket.
felixroom1.title: Felixroom 1

felixroom2.description: When people visit, like Austin here, Felix insists they tour his room and his toys.
felixroom2.title: Felixroom 2

felixroom5.description: Why yes Milo, that blank wall is simply fascinating!
felixroom5.title: Felixroom 5

felixroom6.description: Babies have a walking reflex.  It disappears after a while because they grow too heavy for their reflexive leg movements to move.
felixroom6.title: Felixroom 6

hollypark.description: Felix and Evan at the brand new Holly Park playground.  It's in the park we lived next to during Felix's first year.
hollypark.title: Hollypark

kick1.description: We put the toy bar on the bouncy seat.   How long will it take Milo to figure out how to kick it?

moses_basket.description: This is a common Milo sleeping pose.

yogamoms1.description:
As the women in Lucie's pregnant woman yoga class started dropping babies, it turned into a non-yoga non-pregnant mom's group.

Left to right: Kai, Jago, Milo, Elliot.
yogamoms1.title: Yogamoms 1

yogamoms2.description: Jago was also born on July 24.
yogamoms2.title: Yogamoms 2

description:
Milo loves to suck, but usually refuses bottles and pacifiers. His motto: "flesh is best". Lucie's trying to train him to take the bottle reliably so she can be away from him longer than 3 hours.

The following exchange shows a lot about the state of Felix's language, and the fact that he often remembers who gave him what toy.
Felix: That's my nouveau tow truck.
Lucie: C'est ta dépaneuse? [That's your tow truck?]
Felix: Nana (a)chète me petite (dé)paneuse at frite store. [Nana bought me a little tow truck at McDonald's.]

Felix is starting to confront the idea that everybody grows up. He doesn't like it. Everytime we talk about it, he says he doesn't want to be a big person, which I think is a pretty sane position to hold. One night he woke up crying and that was the first thing out of his mouth. We don't force the issue: we tell him he can stay a boy.

Also, Felix has revealed to us the truth about Felix the Cat. It's actually Felix, disguised as a cat. He's very firm about this: "That's me, (de)guisé chat."
title: September 19
